reviews.review: 出色的剧情，绝美的画面

Удалил игру не зная, что еще было дополнение, пришлось опять скачивать.
Игра сама по себе хороша, рекомендую.

Atrapante, te engancha con la historia y el combate es rápido y violento. Lineal como los bioshock anteriores pero muy entretenido y con giros. La IA de Elizabeth tambien perfecta. Mu bueno 10/10.
Los DLC son muy buenos, especialmente el 2.

С BioShock Infinite мы уже знакомы давно. Даже больше скажу, это была первая игра в серии, с которой мне довелось познакомиться. Тогда, под впечатлением от прохождения Infinite, первые 2 части мне совершенно не зашли, а совсем недавно история снова повторилась, после прохождения первой игры и попыток борьбы с багами второй, мне уже не понравилась Infinite, от чего было решено немного подождать. Время действительно сыграло свою роль, но об этом в итогах.

Сюжетно Infinite просто фантастический, после завершения игры ты остаешься в экстазе на долгое время, а чтобы уловить все микромоменты ЛОРа и повествования, нужно находить всяческие необязательные материалы. Почему такой акцент на этом? Да потому что это не обычный скучный текст, а аудиодневники, небольшие и красиво оформленные видеоролики, диалоги различных болванчиков, это прибавляет интереса в исследовании мира, потому что мне надоедает читать миллионы записок даже в простых коридорных играх.

Графически игра не была выдающейся даже на момент выхода, но стиль решает все. Он максимально карикатурный, несколько мультипликационный и даже не пытается играть на реализме, при этом никак не влияет на восприятие и не чувствуется детским. Придерусь разве только к некоторым совсем уж мыльным текстурам, с которыми порой приходится взаимодействовать на очень близком расстоянии.

Геймлей тут просто отвратителен. Вот так сразу. Шутер из BioShock Infinite как из LADA Racing Club гонки, вроде бы и основной жанр, но все выполнено из рук вон плохо. В выстрелах не чувствуется "сока", даже звуки стрельбы какие-то плоские, будто разработчики хотели почтить традицию первых двух частей, хотя там шутерная механика ещё хуже. Передвигаться неприятно, персонаж чувствуется очень медленным, камеру резко трясет, некоторые элементы взаимодействия вынуждают тебя заниматься пиксель хантингом.

Это пожалуй все, что мне хотелось бы указать. Остальные элементы выполнены просто нормально, как и должны в любой современной (относительно) игре. В итоге я могу сказать, что игра мне очень понравилась ещё много лет назад, а сейчас закрепила мнение и доказала, что выдержала проверку временем. Также Infinite существует как вполне самостоятельное произведение, не требующее знания сюжета первых двух частей, чего не скажешь о DLC. Но! Хотя у меня и не было никакой ностальгии в отношении оригинальной дилогии, все же атмосферно она мне понравилась больше и Infinite после неё чувствуется несколько несерьезно. В любом случае, если вы ещё не притрагивались к BioShock в принципе, сыграйте сначала в Infinite, повременив, завершите оба сюжетные DLC, а только потом приступайте к первым двум играм серии, так сюжет будет восприниматься более цельно и серьезно.

My first time playing this game was back on the Xbox 360 when I was 14 years old And I remember loving this game for its characters, the story, the atmosphere and satisfying first-person gameplay and from this day it still holds up very well from what I remember it being. 

If you're looking for a first-person shooter with a rich story and interesting characters throughout your adventure then this game is worth playing even if you haven't played the other two Bioshock games. 

You play as Booker DeWitt a man that is sent off by an unknown person that the player does not know to presumably do a job by collecting a woman to this unknown person who has sent you on this job to wipe away Booker’s debt. You're then sent to a lighthouse and blasted up to a floating city called Concordia a 1950s like city with a steampunk aesthetic. As you explore the city you discover that something isn't quite right. 

I don't want to say too much I don't want to spoil the game to anybody who hasn't played it  But trust me as I say that it is a game with very interesting environments that tell a story and develop further as you play through. 

The gunplay is satisfying and fun you get a good amount of weapons throughout your playthrough and you also get some really cool abilities as you play through the game with different types of perks and elements to use on enemies. There are also parkouring elements where you can glide on sky rails with a device called a skyhook used to progress through the game And launch above enemies for surprise attacks for fast paste fights.

There are also three additional DLC to this game 2 chapters of a continued story called Burial at Sea which I would highly recommend getting and a survival mode which isn't my favourite but if you enjoy the combat and you want a survival like mode then sure pick that up I guess. 

Keep a eye on this game on your radar especially if there's a deal on it I would recommend picking it up.

a blast to play through, both main campaign and burial at sea dlc. the mechanics are fun and synergize well with one another, vigors are all fun and useful, the weapon variety is fairly large, and so are the enemies. the story is fairly simple at the start, then goes haywire the closer you get to te end. the dlc story is a direct continuation to the main campaign, and can be fairly fun too, even if a tad bit sad. I highly recomend this game.
On top of that, during these sales you can get bioshock 1 & 2, their remasters, this game, and all the dlcs for 15 bucks! this is a STEAL!
Buy the dang bundle, you won't regret it.

Sin duda una excelente adición a la franquicia BioShock, Infinite es una clara muestra de lo imaginativo que puede llegar a ser un videojuego "shooter" en primera persona. El personaje de Elizabeth, un logro como pocos en la historia reciente de los videojuegos, ocupa sin duda un lugar central en esta entrega, y cautiva desde la primera vez que la encontramos durante la trama, haciendo de ella uno de los mejores acompañantes con el que jamás he compartido un juego. La mecánica del juego es sencilla pero atrapante, los ambientes están bellamente diseñados, y la presencia de las llamadas "skylines" a lo largo del juego le dan un toque simplemente fabuloso a las batallas.

It's difficult to review the main things that I liked and disliked about this game without spoiling anything so I'm pretty much forced to leave the story out of it entirely. 
While my primary enjoyment of the game is the story I can still freely review the gameplay as a secondary part.
I have to admit that I'm disappointed with the gameplay in general. You are only allowed to hold two guns at once which is irritating because at any point when you might want to try a new weapon you have to decide if you want it enough to put the one you're currently holding down. You can run out of ammo and be forced to switch to a new gun but that doesn't really feel very good. The gun upgrade system is much less interesting in this game than it was in the previous Bioshock games. Previously you would get a single free upgrade from gun upgrade stations and more often than not the upgrade would do something special, like add an effect to your bullets. This system made you think about what you wanted and then rewarded you for going with it both by changing your gameplay but also by changing how your gun looks, which was very cool. In Infinite you only get number edit changes like more damage, more ammo capacity, better reload speed etc. These upgrades are necessary because of how the difficulty increases but they don't feel especially cool.
The plasmids, known as Vigors, in this game are actually quite fun and were designed to synergize with each other so I found myself trying to use the vigors as a primary attack strategy and only using guns when necessary. In the previous games plasmids were upgraded with a special currency but in this game the only currency is dollars and you use it on everything. That means I usually avoided upgrading my guns so that I could save money for vigors because those upgrades actually did change gameplay instead of just being number edits. It also means that my guns were even less interesting than they already were.

This game has achievements based on beating the hardest difficulty, however you can only unlock it after beating the game once anyway so I would recommend just trying to enjoy it the first time through. Playing it on hard is just an exercise in frustration because the only effect it has is to make your attacks less effective while giving the enemies more health and making them deal more damage. There are some tough enemies that are best defeated in certain ways and you'll have more than enough of a challenge from them on easier difficulties.

Overall, I do recommend this game. It's fun despite the design choices that differ from previous titles and the story offers a lot to think about. I just barely finished playing it from the start for what is probably my third time since it launched and I'm looking forward to playing the DLC again because from what I recall it really improved upon a lot of things in the base game.

I have played both earlier BioShock games. As predecessors, Bioshock Infinite looks very stunning in level design but lacks interaction. After spending 8+ hours I feel the gameplay hasn't changed much but just the names of powers changed. Here you call them Vigors/Salts vs Plasmids/EVE Syringes. I wish there was some interaction and more destructive world but its not ! You cannot interact with any people in game, and they just there as dummies. Gameplay feels very easy in medium difficulty.  Wish they had added some world interaction and improved the gameplay. I would give it 3.5/5

它和《最后生还者》可并称为游戏史的叙事双雄。在游戏史上最人性化的AI——伊丽莎白小姐姐的陪伴下，每个人都能在美轮美奂又暗流涌动的天空之城中进行一场命运的冒险。这是一本用游戏讲故事的教科书、一款真正的艺术品，十年难得一遇的旷世佳作，是一个让你除了目瞪口呆之外什么也说不出来的游戏。

It worked fine with 30fps with a god damn GT9400, why does the GTX550 Ti doesn't work the same way? Even better, maybe because I have Linux? under protondb it's marked as "Native".
